results.title: Dot goes to Hollywood
results.brief_description: Dot sets out on a mighty adventure which takes her to the razzle dazzle of sparkling Hollywood. Once there she becomes a film star to raise money for her little friend Gumley the koala who needs an operation on her eyes. With the help of Hollywood stars, Dot wins a talent quest and is discovered by a famous director, she becomes what all Hollywood dreams are made of - a star.

results.title: Dot and the Whale
results.brief_description: Our heroine Dot and her friend Neptune the dolphin find a whale stranded on an Australian beach and discover that to save her they must first find the old and wise ruler of the sea, Moby Dick. Using animation on beautifully filmed underwater live action scenes, this entertaining family film traces the exciting adventures of Dot and Neptune as they search for Moby Dick.

results.title: Dot and the Smugglers
results.brief_description: A circus owner attempts to capture a mysterious Bunyip, but Dot and her bushland friends try to foil his plans. Dot soon discovers that the circus is merely a front for an international wildlife smuggling operation. Backed by her pals Burra the Kookaburra and two boxing Kangaroos, Dot goes on the warpath.

results.title: Dot and the Koala
results.brief_description: Dot and the Koala opens with the residents of a small Australian country town desperately wanting to lead more exciting, more modern lives. Major Percy Pig convinces the townspeople - a strange collection of haughty cows, hardworking horses and aggressive dogs - that the answer to their problems is a massive dam. The dam will provide the power to catapult the town into the 21st century. When the native animals - kangaroos, wombats and possums - realise the dam will destroy vast tracts of the countryside, open warfare erupts between the two groups.

results.title: Dot and the Bunny
results.brief_description: Dot ventures into the bush determined to finally locate the little lost Joey and reunite him with his mother the kangaroo. On her way she meets a silly bunny rabbit who tries to convince Dot that he is the lost Joey she is looking for. Dot politely explains to her new friend that Joeys have pouches and long tails, just like other kangaroos. Determined to convince Dot, the bunny fashions a pouch and a tail for himself from some shrubs and leaves. Dot is delighted and nicknames him Funny Bunny. Together they set out to search for the lost Joey and Dot tries to console Funny Bunny by explaining how important bunnies are especially at Easter.

results.title: Dot and Keeto
results.brief_description: Dot tumbles into a secret world when she shrinks to insect size in this enchanting tale. Dot and her new friend Keeto the Mosquito become involved in many adventures whilst searching for the secret bark that will return Dot to her normal size. Dot encounters many strange creatures during her searches, including the lovable Butterwalk the Caterpillar, Atlantis the Praying Mantis and the ruthless Queen Ant.

results.title: Dorothy Hewett
results.brief_description: Australia’s best known female playwright, Dorothy Hewett, looks back on her childhood influences and the place of music, poetry and art in her work.
results.description: Australia’s best known female playwright, Dorothy Hewett, looks back on her childhood influences and the place of music, poetry and art in her work.

results.title: Dorothy Hewett
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia Council archival film series: writers III”.
Dorothy Hewett reflects on her life as a playwright, poet, author and teacher. Hewett grew up in Western Australia and has been a writer all her life. A political, social and sexual rebel, she has created work which has often been controversial for its frankness and for the power of her female central characters. In this 1991 interview, Hewett discusses the professional and personal relationships that have enriched her life and inspired her writing. She also speaks about ageing and her struggle to overcome the loss of physical power. Research and interview: James Murdoch.

results.title: Dorothy Heathcote talks to teachers. Pt. 2 (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Dana H. Hodgdon, Bernice Gregorio and Northwestern University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Dorothy Heathcote Teaching series”.
Drama in the classroom continues with the discussion of techniques developed by Mrs. Heathcote. “Questioning”, “storyline”, “universals” and “brother hoods” are examined. Drama is related to developing language and social skills, while teaching subject material. Mrs. Heathcote’s educative process is based on total involvement that ultimately modifies behaviour.
